summary: This document is an FBI 302 form (detective preparation memo) dated July 12, 2021, summarizing a witness's recollections for trial testimony. It details the witness's account of visiting Jeffrey Epstein's house for massages, the frequency of visits, payments received, and contact with a scheduler.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE'; the individual whose house the witness visited for massages.

connections.description: El visited Epstein's house for massages and received payments, indicating a transactional relationship centered around Epstein's alleged abuse.
IN was invited to Epstein's house, suggesting she was also a potential victim or associate in the context of the allegations.
IN was dating am, as mentioned in the context of am having a job.

events.title: Trial Testimony Preparation
events.description: AUSAs and a detective prepared a memo summarizing a witness's (El's) recollections for upcoming trial testimony.

keyFacts: A witness (El) believed she was about 16 years old when first invited to Jeffrey Epstein's house.
The witness estimated visiting Epstein's house approximately once or twice a month for two months, then biweekly, then weekly.
The witness estimated receiving between $200 and $300 after each massage at Epstein's house.
The witness recalled a woman with a European (but not French) accent called to schedule appointments for visits to Epstein.
